src:
Iz Nebes na zemljo
V Idriji so odprli Center za obiskovalce. Unesco globalnega Geoparka Idrija, novost v turistični ponudbi destinacije in vstopna točka v geopark.
05 Nov 2019, 19:25 by Primož Hieng



Antonijev rov skriva več kot 500-letno tradicijo rudarjenja.



Idrija vabi v nedrje geoparka.



Žlikrofi so znamenita idrijska dediščina.



Del geoparka je Divje jezero.


Geopark Idrija je v sklopu projekta Danube GeoTour pripravil nov center za obiskovalce in razstavo Zapisano v kamninah. Je v prostorih nekdanje gostilne Nebesa, kamor se je v septembru preselil tudi TIC Idrija.
Lokalno prebivalstvo v parku varuje naravo in skrbi za razvoj podeželja.
Razstava prikazuje, kako so Zemljine sile vplivale na nastanek idrijskega območja in izoblikovale življenje. Predstavlja vsebine iz celotnega območja Geoparka Idrija. »Z razstavo želimo spodbuditi obiskovalce, da poleg obiska naših glavnih turističnih ponudnikov v mestu Idrija obiščejo tudi idrijsko podeželje, si tam ogledajo naravne in kulturne znamenitosti ter pridejo v stik s turističnimi ponudniki zunaj mesta in se pri nas zadržijo dlje,« pravijo na Zavodu za turizem Idrija.


Idrija vabi v nedrje geoparka.

Uvod v idrijsko zgodbo je osnovna razlaga nastanka našega planeta ter procesov, ki naš planet ohranjajo živega, da se stalno spreminja. »Prikazati želimo, da procesi v Zemlji in na njej v svoji osnovi določajo okolje ter kamninsko in morfološko pestrost, ki se mu prilagajajo rastline in živali ter ne nazadnje tudi človek s svojim načinom življenja. Pomembno sporočilo razstave je, da se globalni procesi odražajo tudi lokalno,« so še povedali.Razstava je bogata z maketami, modeli, zanimivimi eksponati, animacijami in videopredstavitvami, s pomočjo katerih bodo vsebine predstavili tistim, ki jih ta snov le bežno zanima, in tistim, ki se želijo v vsebine bolj poglobiti. Najmlajšim so namenjene tri otroške točke, na katerih bodo na igriv in interaktiven način odkrivali naravne zanimivosti in zakonitosti. Izpustili niso niti projektnih partnerjev, ki se bodo na moderen način, s pomočjo digitalne tehnologije, predstavili obiskovalcem med celotno razstavo.Zavod za turizem Idrija je v ta namen pridobil 104.000 evrov iz skladov Evropske unije, kar je 85 odstotkov proračuna za vzpostavitev centra, v to pa so vključeni stroški osebja, administracije, potni stroški, stroški zunanjih izvajalcev ter oprema in


Žlikrofi so znamenita idrijska dediščina.

infrastruktura za razstavo. Preostalih 15 odstotkov je zagotovila Občina Idrija. Poleg tega je zavod za turizem iz svojega proračuna za delovanje Geoparka Idrija za opremo v centru namenil 24.650 evrov. Sredstva za ureditev prostorov, primernih za izdelavo razstave ter delovanje TIC, je zagotovila občina.Kaj pravzaprav je geopark? »To je območje z izjemnimi naravnimi danostmi, v katerem se lokalno prebivalstvo poveže z namenom varovati naravo in skrbeti za razvoj podeželja,« odgovarjajo na zavodu. »Poleg geoloških znamenitosti so v geoparku predstavljene tudi vse preostale zvrsti naravne in kulturna dediščina. Osnovne naloge geoparka so zaščita in ohranitev geološke dediščine, izobraževanje za različne skupine – učilnice v naravi in sodelovanje z lokalnimi skupnostmi. Pomembni so povezanost, spoštovanje in sožitje domačinov z naravo.« 


Del geoparka je Divje jezero.
text:
From heaven to earth
Visitors Center opened in Idrija. UNESCO Global Idrija Geopark, a novelty in the tourist offer of the destination and the entry point into the geopark.
05 Nov 2019, 19:25 by Primoz Hieng



Antony's Trench hides more than 500 years of mining tradition.



Idrija invites you to the geopark.



Glycrophs are a famous Idrija heritage.



Part of the geopark is Wild Lake.


Within the Danube GeoTour project, the Idrija Geopark has prepared a new Visitors Center and the Recorded in Rocks exhibition. It is on the premises of the former Nebes tavern, where the Idrija TIC moved in September.
The local population in the park protects nature and cares for rural development.
The exhibition shows how Earth's forces influenced the formation of the Idrija region and shaped life. It presents content from the entire area of the Idrija Geopark. "The exhibition aims to encourage visitors to visit the Idrija countryside in addition to visiting our main tourist providers in the town of Idrija, see the natural and cultural sights there, and get in touch with tourist providers outside the city and stay with us longer," they say at the Institute for tourism Idrija.


Idrija invites you to the geopark.

The introduction to the Idrija story is a basic explanation of the origin of our planet and the processes that keep our planet alive so that it changes constantly. “We want to show that the processes in and on Earth are essentially determined by the environment and the rock and morphological diversity to which plants and animals adapt, and not least by man with his way of life. An important message of the exhibition is that global processes are also reflected locally, "they said. The exhibition is rich in models, models, interesting exhibits, animations and video presentations that will present content to those who are only interested in the substance, and to those who want to get deeper into the content. The youngest are intended for three children's spots where they will discover natural attractions and laws in a playful and interactive way. They also did not release their project partners, who will present themselves to visitors throughout the exhibition in a modern way using digital technology. To this end, the Idrija Tourism Office has raised 104,000 euros from European Union funds, which is 85 percent of the budget for the establishment of the center. these include staff, administration, travel, outsourcing costs and equipment and


Glycrophs are a famous Idrija heritage.

infrastructure for the exhibition. The remaining 15 percent was provided by the Municipality of Idrija. In addition, the Tourism Institute allocated € 24,650 from the budget for the operation of the Geopark Idrija for the equipment in the center. Funds for the arrangement of the premises suitable for the production of the exhibition and the operation of the TIC were provided by the municipality. What exactly is a geopark? "This is an area with exceptional natural resources, in which the local population connects with the aim of protecting nature and caring for rural development," the institute said. “In addition to the geological sights, all other genres of natural and cultural heritage are represented in the geopark. The basic tasks of the geopark are to protect and preserve the geological heritage, to educate for different groups - classrooms in nature and to work with local communities. The connection, respect and sympathy of the natives with nature are important. "


Part of the geopark is Wild Lake.
